11.12.18  8:17 pm   You don't seem to have answered any questions in the last 24 hours. Are you dead?

11.12.18  7:49 pm   Do you ever think about having mainstream success with one of your music,

      like having one of your songs 'on the charts'?

      Would you ever write a song with the specific intention of trying to make a pop song

      or do you think it's best to stay true to yourself and make your music how you like it?

      Sorry if that came off sounding rude, I know you've already had a lot of success with your stuff and have lots of devoted fans. I've probably listened to your music more than any other artist in the past year or so.. but I'd like to see you selling out madison square garden and hearing your songs whenever I turn on the radio, etc. I think there's a lot of pop artists who actively try to make 'pop music'.. which isn't to say that pop can't still be unique or great or whatever, but I think there's more to writing pop than just making what you like. I think a lot of these artists are really good at looking at trends in music and knowing how to appeal to a wide audi ence and all that stuff.

11.12.18  7:16 pm   I have a song, who has "G# A B C D E F" for the main melody line. WHAT IS HER KEY H E L P M E!!!!! also she has Am Fmaj Gmaj and Emaj for the main chord progression which looks like complete bullshit when i try to search for keys online IM COMPLETELY LOST IS MY SONG WRONG SHE SOUNDS RIGHT

11.12.18  2:23 am   Here's the situation. I have a finite amount of time to release quite a bit of content. I know what the content is going to be and am now in the process of making the content and then making it good. But my issue is that I keep getting stuck on this first video. I've made and finished the 10 videos after the first one and now I've made the first one 10 different times and I'm still not happy with it. The dilemma is this: Do I keep trying to make it better or suck it up and release the bad stuff? Or is there a third option... maybe a fourth, too.

11.11.18  4:18 pm   Would you say that a lot of your answers on this page agree with this philosophy, particularly ones about breaking rules and "what is meaningful in the universe? you"?

"Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of the universe. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." ~Mariann e Williamson
